I typically make a ~/bin directory and symlink in there after I add it to my $PATH.
which part?
make a symlink in there (assuming you didn't install the app directly in that directory) like this "ln -s /path/to/your/executable ~/bin/execname"
then to add it to your $PATH, do this "export PATH="$HOME/bin:$PATH""
to make it part of your path at each session, add that export command to your ~/.bashrc file.
no sweat.
